etymology.description: 人(人) (rén, 'person') + 口(口) (kǒu, 'mouth') — person mouth
etymology.interpretation: This combination makes sense because 口(口) (kǒu, 'mouth') serves as a measure word for people, referring to the count or number of individuals. 人(人) (rén, 'person') denotes the individuals that make up a population.

parts.english: mouth; opening; entrance; measure word for people
